title: Convention Plugin Config DSL
description: Build a type-safe DSL for configuring team convention standards. The DSL should allow specifying code style rules, dependency constraints, and test coverage thresholds.
instructions: Implement a Kotlin DSL using builder pattern with lambda receivers. Create a TeamConventions class configured via a teamConventions { } block that accepts code style settings, dependency rules, and coverage requirements.

testCases.description: DSL should capture code style settings

hints.text: Use a function with a lambda receiver: fun teamConventions(block: TeamConventionsBuilder.() -> Unit)
Nested DSLs use the same pattern: fun codeStyle(block: CodeStyleBuilder.() -> Unit)
Builders accumulate settings, then build() creates the immutable config

commonMistakes.consequence: Inner blocks can accidentally call outer scope functions
commonMistakes.correction: Use @DslMarker annotation on builder classes to restrict scope access
